thread.title: Wal-Mart to Expand Grocery Pickup Service
thread.title_full: Wal-Mart to Expand Grocery Pickup Service

title: Wal-Mart to Expand Grocery Pickup Service
text:
Wal-Mart Looks to U.K. Unit for Lessons on Online Groceries (April 21) 
The new locations are part of a bigger expansion of the service, said a spokesman for the company. In recent weeks, the retailer has added dozens of grocery-pickup locations to parking lots of Supercenter and Neighborhood Markets around Phoenix, Denver and Huntsville, Ala., the spokesman said. 
The service lets a shopper order groceries and other products online then choose a pickup time. Upon reaching the Wal-Mart parking lot, the shopper calls the store and employees bring the food or other merchandise to the car. There is a minimum order amount of $30. 
Wal-Mart’s growing investment in grocery-pickup locations comes at a time when grocers and other retailers are scrambling to find a way to make grocery delivery or pickup popular and profitable. The logistics of handling fresh, frozen and room-temperature food and delivering to a wide swath of homes for a reasonable price is tricky. 
Wal-Mart opened its first grocery-delivery test in San Jose, Calif., in 2011, expanding it to Denver in 2013, but has since focused on opening more pickup locations. 
“The U.S. is a car-based country. Convenience for many Americans isn’t waiting at home for something to show up,” said Bryan Gildenberg, chief knowledge officer at Kantar Retail, a research and consulting firm. 
Also on Tuesday, Target Corp. said it would partner with grocery-delivery service Instacart to let some Minneapolis, Minn., shoppers order groceries and a limited number of other items online for home delivery within hours. 
Both Target and Wal-Mart already allow online shoppers to order from their website and pickup inside stores, usually within days. 
Write to Sarah Nassauer at sarah.nassauer@wsj.com 42
